title: Quiz 1: Introduction to Nursing Research
description: Comprehensive assessment of research definitions, characteristics, and sources of knowledge.

questions.question: Which of the following best defines 'Research' according to Burns and Grove (1999)?

options.text: A casual process of gathering information.
A diligent, systematic inquiry to validate and refine existing knowledge.
An attempt to gain solutions to problems using tradition.
A method of treating patients based on intuition.

questions.explanation: Burns and Grove emphasize 'diligent, systematic inquiry' to validate/refine knowledge.
questions.hint: Think about the systematic nature of scientific inquiry.

questions.question: Match the source of knowledge to its definition.

pairs.right: Knowledge from experts in a specialized area
Insight by instinct without conscious reasoning

questions.explanation: Tradition comes from customs, Authority from experts, Intuition from instinct, Experience from personal involvement.
questions.hint: Consider how each type of knowledge is acquired.

questions.question: Which of the following are specific purposes of nursing research? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Finding ways to increase cost-effectiveness
Providing a basis for standard setting
Defending a professional status for nursing
Reducing the need for patient interaction

questions.explanation: Nursing research aims to improve cost-effectiveness, set standards, and establish professional status.
questions.hint: Focus on benefits to the nursing profession and patient care.

questions.question: The term 'Phenomenon' refers to an event or a ___BLANK___ that can be seen to happen or exist.
questions.explanation: A phenomenon is an event or situation that can be observed.
questions.hint: Think of something observable in reality.

questions.question: Nursing research is limited only to the study of nurses and their educational background.
questions.explanation: Nursing research includes nursing practice, education, and administration, focusing on patient care.
questions.hint: Consider the broader scope of nursing beyond just nurses themselves.

questions.question: Which characteristic is NOT associated with the scientific method of research?

options.text: Systematic
Subjective
Objective
Logical

questions.explanation: Scientific research is objective, not subjective.

questions.question: Match the Research Purpose with its function.

pairs.right: Give accurate profile of a group

questions.explanation: Exploratory generates ideas, Descriptive profiles groups, Prediction estimates outcomes, Control regulates phenomena.
questions.hint: Think about what each research purpose achieves.

questions.question: What is the primary goal of Evidence-Based Practice?

options.text: To reduce hospital budget
To provide best possible care based on research
To strictly follow tradition
To increase the number of staff

questions.explanation: EBP integrates best research evidence with clinical expertise and patient values.

questions.question: Scientific research is marked by patience, courage, and ___BLANK___ activities.
questions.explanation: Scientific research requires unhurried, careful activities.
questions.hint: Think about the pace of careful scientific work.

questions.question: Why is research important for the credibility of the nursing profession? (Select all that apply)

options.text: It builds a distinct body of knowledge
It demonstrates nursing's role in health to the public
It eliminates the need for doctors
It defines nursing as a profession, not just a vocation

questions.explanation: Research builds knowledge, demonstrates value, and establishes nursing as a profession.
questions.hint: Consider how research affects public perception and professional status.
